name: Manchebo Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, I am writing my trip report months out from my vacation. Our stay at the Manchebo was excellent and I am already looking into booking our next stay at this great beach front hotel.
reviews.title: Best Beach in Aruba

likes.liked: — Small, quiet hotel on perfect beach, plenty of palapas spaced far apart for privacy

reviews.text: We read a lot of reviews before booking. We wanted to be in the low rise hotel section of Aruba. We do not want the busy, busy area that the high- rise section offered. We are on vacation and want to relax as much as we can. The Manchebo is not far from Orangestead or the high rise section if you want more action.
reviews.title: Fun time in Aruba June ' 07

likes.liked: — Eagle Beach is so large and beautiful
likes.disliked: — Service could have been a bit more friendly at certain restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Manchebo from February 7-14th, 2007. The front is very basic when you drive up, but once you walk into the open air lobby, you know that you are in the Caribbean! The lobby has teak furnishings, a book exchange, internet access, and a small store. The front desk staff was very helpful and kind. The rooms had all recently been updated with flat screen tvs and new furniture. The rooms had plenty of storage and a safe and small fridge. We had a garden view room, but it wound up being partial ocean view as well. Our room was located back near the beach, by the Spa.
reviews.title: Wonderful beach and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at the French Steakhouse was excellent, from food, to service and entertainment. We ate at the beach bar several times and the Garden Terrace for breakfast. Happy Hour was 2 for 1 drinks from 5-7pm each night. We ate all our other meals off the resort since we like to sample all the local restaurants/specialties. I do not recommend AI because there are so many wonderful places to eat.
reviews.title: Relax, rekindle, refresh... repeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The island is expensive, but we went to the supermarket (a 5 min. bus or cab ride) and got beach snacks, water, beer and soda and really saved some money. Other people did this as well and brought little coolers to the beach with them.
reviews.title: Excellent Beach, Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Bathroom facilities as they are quite dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I spent May 5-10 at Manchebo. Overall, we had an excellent experience, though there were a few quirks (more later).
reviews.title: Excellent trip, a few quirks. We'll definitely go back!

reviews.text: BEACH. First off, the beach was amazing. It is reason enough to choose Manchebo. It was so white and so wide. The water was incredibly blue, and we did not see many waves at all (in fact, we only had one day with even mild waves). The water was refreshing (not cold) and we got used to the temp fairly quickly. We never had trouble getting a palapa, and were even able to get a front row spot in the middle of one afternoon. At night, the beach is virtually deserted, and we enjoyed pulling out a couple of chairs, looking at the stars, and feeling like we had the whole beach to ourselves.
reviews.title: Liked It...Didn't Love it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOTEL. The hotel is very nice, and very basic. The rooms were recently renovated with new furniture and flat panel tvs. The bathrooms, while very clean, were somewhat dated looking (pastel shower curtains, pink corain counters, but we didn't care at all). We had a fridge in the room for all of our tasty leftovers. Our fridge had a leak when we first arrived, but it was fixed immediately. One minor complaint here--we did have some very small ant-like things in the front entryway/fridge area. Never saw them inside the fridge or in the rest of the room. The area isn't the most happening after hours, but it is certainly easy to get to the "action."
reviews.title: More than enough!

likes.liked: — location, service by all staff, no smoking policy in restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: STAFF. The staff was universally helpful and friendly. The front desk staff was also great giving us directions and helping me get medical attention for a suddenly arising (minor) problem. The cleaning and grounds crew did a great job.
reviews.title: Great Location for Quiet Time

likes.disliked: — Not enough rooms with a King Bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MEALS. We ate at the French Steakhouse once (a very nice dinner with a good piano player), had dessert and drinks late one night at the Italian place (delicious chocolate mousse and tiramisu), and had one lunch at Pega Pega (good, nothing exceptional. Also, we didn't love the flies everywhere, but that's pretty typical when eating on the beach). We enjoyed happy hour at Pega Pega. Try the "Brown Lady" frozen cocktail! We did not do all inclusive, largely because there are just too many good restaurants in Aruba.
reviews.title: Relax and Unwind at Manchebo

likes.disliked: — Not much cold water in bathrooms

reviews.text: Only stayed here for one evening but was very happy that we did!! If I could rank this place a 4.5 - I would. A 4 seems a bit too low but then again it's not quite a 5.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were traveling with our youngest child (16 year old daughter) and when we were planning our trip we had come down to the Manchebo or an AI resort on the island. We eliminated the Manchebo because the AI cost was significantly higher than the competitor when our daughter was factored in at 50% of an adult cost as compared to the other resort whiich provided tremendous value - our 16 year old was free! As it turned out the other resort only had availability for 5 nights - so we booked the Manchebo for our sixth and final night - room only not AI.
reviews.title: Great relaxing beach!
If heaven isn't this great i'm comin back!!!!
reviews.text: The Manchebo is very unpretentious and has a definite Caribbean laid back vibe/atmosphere. Exactly what we were looking for as this was meant to be a relaxing vacation. The hotel itself is not particularly special - little more than a two floor cinder block motor inn. However - the rooms are very nicely done/updated with flat screen tv's, small fridges, microwaves, etc. The rooms were extremely clean with tiled floors and updated bathrooms. We had a second floor ocean front which was spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful with plenty of palapas and palms for shade and plenty of space. No problem finding a spot to claim as your own - plus spaced far enough apart that you were not on top of your neighbor - good news for the topless bathers as they had plenty of privacy. Plus there is beach service if you are really into laying around.
reviews.title: Manchebo a great couples hotel

reviews.text: We ate lunch at the Pega Pega beach bar and were not disappointed at all. The food was very fresh, cooked to order and of a high quality. Lunch at the beach bar also had many choices. The drinks were cold and generous and the service came with a smile.
reviews.title: friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Manchebo was just what we were looking for - a great beach vacation spent relaxing at a smaller, value hotel in the low rise section. The beach is really amazing, it has to be as much as 100 yards wide in places, with many palapas and palms. Its perfect for long walks, although the swimming/snorkeling is not great. Never had trouble finding a spot to layout.
reviews.title: Liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is unpretentious. We really enjoyed the laid back ambience, with many europeans. The rooms were clean, tiled, more like a motel in the US (walls thin too). Still a great value for the price, compared to other hotels.
reviews.title: Manchebo the way to go!

likes.disliked: — No fitness center to speak of

reviews.text: We ate breakfasts and lunches there, nothing special but it was fine - we were there for the beach not the food.
reviews.title: We Will Be Back Here Again!!!

likes.disliked: — rooms could use some updating but still very clean

reviews.text: Actually, the neighboring Bucuti Resort looks like the best place in Aruba - would highly recommend staying there (it was booked when we made our reservations). They have a great breakfast, restaurant for dinner, very pleasant atmosphere, service wonderful. Nice dinner package - your own tent on the beach, which we tried our last night. Very romantic!
reviews.title: Nice Resort, Loved Aruba
Great Beach, good location
reviews.text: We didn't care for the high rise resorts, too americanized for our tastes. If you're looking for a great value and beach, try Manchebo!

description: The ultimate Caribbean vacation experience begins at our intimate, 2-story boutique resort located on the shores of majestic Eagle Beach, an ideal place for romantic and rejuvenating getaways. The newly-renovated Deluxe Ocean and Deluxe Garden View Rooms offer attention to details and amenities, including spa-like bathrooms offering a rain/waterfall shower. The beach-side exotic Caribbean-Balinese style spa offers a variety of massages, body treatments and yoga & Pilates classes. Optional premium fully a-la-carte all-inclusive program available featuring Ike's Bistro and French Steakhouse.
